sen.j: 梅若玄祥（うめわかげんしょう）は、シテ方観世流の一派で能楽師、梅若家の名跡。
sen.e: Gensho UMEWAKA is one of the professional Noh actor names of the Umewaka Family, a branch of one of shite-kata (main role) schools of Noh, or Kanze School.
sen.cmt: シテ方観世流」は、ウェブ辞書では site-kata of Kanze school とありましたが、これでは「観世流のシテ方」であって、「シテ方である観世流」は意味しません。したがって、そのままは採用しませんでした。
sen.e: Gensho UMEWAKA is one of the professional Noh actor names of the Umewaka Family, a branch of one of shite-kata (main role) schools of Noh, or Kanze School.
Gensho UMEWAKA is one of the professional Noh actor names of the Umewaka Family, a branch of one of shite-kata (main role) schools of Noh, or Kanze School.

sen.j: 初世 梅若九郎右衛門玄祥。
sen.e: The first Noh actor who used the name was Kuroemon UMEWAKA, or UMEWAKA Kuroemon Gensho.
The first Noh actor who used the name was Kuroemon UMEWAKA, or UMEWAKA Kuroemon Gensho.
The first Noh actor who used the name was Kuroemon UMEWAKA, or UMEWAKA Kuroemon Gensho.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期に活躍し、梅若家中興の祖とされる。
sen.e: He performed Noh in the early part of the Edo period and is known to be responsible for the restoration of the Umewaka Family.
sen.cmt: 「中興の祖」はウェブ辞書にありましたが、不適切だと思いましたので、先のように意訳しました。
sen.e: He performed Noh in the early part of the Edo period and is known to be responsible for the restoration of the Umewaka Family.
He became well know for his Noh performances in the early part of the Edo period, and is known as the Chuko no So (father of restoration) of the Umewaka Family.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて訳文を修正

sen.j: 二世 → 梅若六郎 (56世)を参照。
sen.e: Refer to Rokuro UMEWAKA (the 56th) for the second Gensho.
Refer to Rokuro UMEWAKA (the 56th) for the second Gensho.
Refer to Rokuro UMEWAKA (the 56th) for the second Gensho.
